required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of SLCO2B1 Genotype and Apple Juice on Pharmacokinetics of Atenolol After Oral Administration in Healthy Male Korean
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label, Single-dose, Three-treatment, Three-period Study to Investigate the Effect of SLCO2B1 Genotype and Apple Juice on Pharmacokinetics of Atenolol After Oral Administration in Healthy Male Korean

brief_summary.textblock: An open-label, single-dose, three-treatment, three-period study to investigate the effect of SLCO2B1 genotype and apple juice on pharmacokinetics of atenolol after oral administration in healthy male Korean.

primary_outcome.measure: AUC of atenolol according to the SLCO2B1 genotypes
primary_outcome.description: The area under the plasma concentration versus time curve, from time 0 to the last measurable concentration, as calculated by the linear/log trapezoidal method will be summarized by treatment and genotype group using descriptive statistics.

secondary_outcome.measure: Blood pressure of the subjects who administered atenolol according to the SLCO2B1 genotypes
secondary_outcome.description: Blood pressure measurement will be presented as descriptive statistics for the difference from baseline where appropriate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Adverse Events as a Measure of Safety and Tolerability
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with adverse event as a measure of safety and tolerability *Measure of safety and tolerability: physical examinations, ECG, Laboratory tests (including hematology, chemistry, urinalysis) - Descriptive statistics will be calculated for quantitative safety data as well as for the difference from baseline where appropriate.

intervention.description: Atenolol oral administration with apple juice 1200 mL
Atenolol oral administration with apple juice 600 mL

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject is informed of the investigational nature of this study and voluntarily agrees to participate in this study and signs an Institutional Review Board (IRB) - approved informed consent prior to performing any of the screening procedures
Exclusion Criteria:
- A subject with history of allergies including study drug (atenolol) or other drug allergies (aspirin, antibiotics, etc.), or history of clinically significant allergies

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor of Clinical Pharmacology and Therapeutics
